bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 13, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes about Mabel Lazear's trip home and his son's health.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 13, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad to get
your letter a day or two ago.
I wonder if you have felt
the effects of the western
blizzard.

Mabel's steamer is to leave tomorrow
sometime which will make
her reach Baltimore on Wednesday
or Thursday. She will telegraph
from N.Y. to let you know she
has arrived and so that
some one can meet her at the
terminus of the electric cars
opposite Mount Holly. She will
also telegraph to Snyder to meet
her at the train with a wagon
ready to take the trunks out.
to Windsor. I think everything is
in order for the trip and Mabel
will not have any trouble.
It is very fortunate that she
can get a transport as they
only charge a dollar and
a half a day. So the whole
trip will be less than twelve
dollars. By the regular line
it would be $65 for the two.
and by Tampa about a hundred
and twenty-five.

Houston has been very well lately but
he has not grown much in
the last two months. He sleeps
well now and plays hard all
day long.
